  <description>
    <facet>
      <vocabularyID>LRE.expressionDescriptionFacetValues</vocabularyID>
      <value>main</value>
    </facet>
    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>ILMoE</catalog>
            <entry>ILMoE1269</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Birkat Hamazon5</string>
          </title>
          <language>en</language>
          <description>
            <string language="en">In this lesson, learners will explore the idea that God the provider of all things, including food. Birkat Hamazon will be seen as a means of showing gratitude for the food that God has provided.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">Birkat Hamazon</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">prayer</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">lookstein center</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">gratitude</string>
          </keyword>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">In dieser Lektion erforschen Anfänger die Idee 
daß Gott der Versorger aller Sachen, einschließlich Nahrung. 
Birkat Hamazon wird als Mittel des Zeigens von von Dankbarkeit 
für die Nahrung gesehen, daß Gott zur Verfügung gestellt hat.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Dans cette leçon, les étudiants exploreront 
l'idée que Dieu le fournisseur de toutes les choses, y compris la 
nourriture. Birkat Hamazon sera vu en tant que des moyens de 
montrer la gratitude pour la nourriture que Dieu a fourni.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Nesta lição, os learners explorarão a idéia 
que deus o fornecedor de todas as coisas, including o alimento. 
Birkat Hamazon será visto como meios de mostrar a gratitude 
para o alimento que o deus forneceu.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">In questa lezione, i principianti esploreranno 
l'idea che dio il fornitore di tutte le cose, compreso alimento. 
Birkat Hamazon sarà visto come mezzi di mostrare il 
ringraziamento per l'alimento che il dio ha fornito.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Σε αυτό το μάθημα, οι αρχάριοι θα ερευνήσουν την ιδέα
εκείνος ο Θεός ο προμηθευτής όλων των πραγμάτων, 
συμπεριλαμβανομένων των τροφίμων. Το Birkat Hamazon θα 
δει ως μέσο εμφάνισης ευγνωμοσύνης για τα τρόφιμα που 
ο Θεός έχει παράσχει.</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">En esta lección, los principiantes explorarán la
idea que dios el abastecedor de todas las cosas, incluyendo el 
alimento. Birkat Hamazon será visto como los medios de mostrar 
la gratitud para el alimento que el dios ha proporcionado.</string>
          </description>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Birkat Hamazon</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Gebet</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">lookstein Mitte</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Dankbarkeit</string>
          </keyword>

          </keyword>

          </keyword>
